title: The NORTH POLE
body_text:
The high-profile "Dream Match" between two honored figures -
John Tronolone
versus
Tom Adams
for the very first time ever! Santa's come early!
"How the West was Won" quickly became the motto of this nail-biting 117th spectacular. Beginning not on the "east", the third eldest Adams struck first. Key allies such as flame-throwing right-hander Kevin Fitzpatrick and 8th grade superstar Rob Pellecchia were nearly unstoppable in the opening contest. Tronolone, though with a glowing smile, was not all too surprised with the initial outcome - his poor captains record a sure reason why. But the self-proclaimed "Creation" counted himself and his supporting cast out way too early because when Game 2 rolled around, Tronolone was on the board.
From here on out, it was anybody's ballgame with the "west side" a place of good fortune and a little luck. Not until the grueling 8th round, two long hours into this bloodthristy conflict, did "Greek God" Adams finally break the curse of the "east", taking the pivotal multi-point lead  and ultimately spelling the demise of his "Greek" counterpart.
Flash Results by Game
:
Tom Adams defeated John Tronolone, 5 to 4
.
Adams: 1, 3, 5, 7, 8
Tronolone: 2, 4, 6, 9
Since the Ocean Road Park days of '05 to the ultra-competitive Wall High School wars of the modern era, these iconic superpowers have completely annihilated one another. But despite the numerous, numbing nutshots and the ever-so brutal faceshot just a few short weeks ago, Tom and John could be seen respectfully shaking hands at the conclusion of this unforgettable 2nd Annual Christmas Spectacular.
Moments & Stars
: Melissa Kerr's incredible one-handed fumble catch; the ongoing saga between Tom Adams and Bobby Vetrano; newbie Doug Homan's impressive power display; the fearless showing from Michael Tronolone
Xmas Xtras!
First and foremost, special
Thanks!
to the one and only Chris Adams who put together one hell of a "Chris-mas" soundtrack - and he wasn't even there! That's dedication for you. Mike "Sputz" Krott, Melissa Kerr, and Diana DiBuccio beautifully decorated the court with holiday lights, signs, and glowing ribbon giving ONE-SEVENTEEN that special atmosphere. And it certainly wasn't hard to notice the attire and wacked-out hairstyles of some of the combatants: Sascha Basista and Cap. John Tronolone in their Dollar Tree Santa hats; Mike "Sputz" in a sweet yellow and purple Minnesota Vikings hat; and the outrageously spiked hairdo of rookie-of-the-year sensation Rob Pellecchia.
2nd Annual Christmas RECORDS
Attendance: 23
Notable Returns: Michael Tronolone (last competed at DB 30); Dan Caron (last competed at DB LXXVI)
*New Players: (3) Doug Homan, Dave Larsen, Casey Wolf
- ONE-SEVENTEEN was the first event in Winter 2007/2008 and the 29th straight event held on the back courts of Wall High School.
- *It had been three week dry spell without any new players.
- In the special holiday showdown, Tom Adams narrowly defeated John Tronolone, 5 to 4.
..
Tom Adams
now 5-2-0, is one of the most dominant captains ever. In his most previous match, he defeated Alison Bertsch at NINETY-NINE one day shy of his 21st birthday.
..
John Tronolone
suffered his record-breaking 8th loss, having gone winless the entire 2007 year. This was his record-tying 11th time as captain as well (along with Chris Adams).
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
DODGEBALL 118: Double Header Friday!
It was to see the return of the ever-so violent
BoxBall Dodgeball
. Plans however have been scrapped - what will happen on this special Friday event? Find out December 28.
DODGEBALL 119: Double Header Saturday!
The test of stamina and endurance continues on December 29. Who knows what to expect!
DODGEBALL CXX: Season Finale Extravaganza!
Their never-say-die drive and overall athletic ability have catapulted each of these deserving participants to the pinnacle of a dodgeball player's career. As announced at DODGEBALL ONE-SEVENTEEN,
PLAYER of the Year
nominee
Ryan Letsche
clashes with
ROOKIE of the Year
candidate
Grant Cornero
at the Season 12 Finale on January 5. This is will be a classic.
body_html:
The high-profile "Dream Match" between two honored figures - John Tronolone versus Tom Adams for the very first time ever! Santa's come early!

"How the West was Won" quickly became the motto of this nail-biting 117th spectacular. Beginning not on the "east", the third eldest Adams struck first. Key allies such as flame-throwing right-hander Kevin Fitzpatrick and 8th grade superstar Rob Pellecchia were nearly unstoppable in the opening contest. Tronolone, though with a glowing smile, was not all too surprised with the initial outcome - his poor captains record a sure reason why. But the self-proclaimed "Creation" counted himself and his supporting cast out way too early because when Game 2 rolled around, Tronolone was on the board.

From here on out, it was anybody's ballgame with the "west side" a place of good fortune and a little luck. Not until the grueling 8th round, two long hours into this bloodthristy conflict, did "Greek God" Adams finally break the curse of the "east", taking the pivotal multi-point lead and ultimately spelling the demise of his "Greek" counterpart.

Flash Results by Game: Tom Adams defeated John Tronolone, 5 to 4.
Adams: 1, 3, 5, 7, 8
Tronolone: 2, 4, 6, 9

Since the Ocean Road Park days of '05 to the ultra-competitive Wall High School wars of the modern era, these iconic superpowers have completely annihilated one another. But despite the numerous, numbing nutshots and the ever-so brutal faceshot just a few short weeks ago, Tom and John could be seen respectfully shaking hands at the conclusion of this unforgettable 2nd Annual Christmas Spectacular.

Moments & Stars: Melissa Kerr's incredible one-handed fumble catch; the ongoing saga between Tom Adams and Bobby Vetrano; newbie Doug Homan's impressive power display; the fearless showing from Michael Tronolone

Xmas Xtras!
First and foremost, special Thanks! to the one and only Chris Adams who put together one hell of a "Chris-mas" soundtrack - and he wasn't even there! That's dedication for you. Mike "Sputz" Krott, Melissa Kerr, and Diana DiBuccio beautifully decorated the court with holiday lights, signs, and glowing ribbon giving ONE-SEVENTEEN that special atmosphere. And it certainly wasn't hard to notice the attire and wacked-out hairstyles of some of the combatants: Sascha Basista and Cap. Attendance: 23
Notable Returns: Michael Tronolone (last competed at DB 30); Dan Caron (last competed at DB LXXVI)
*New Players: (3) Doug Homan, Dave Larsen, Casey Wolf

- ONE-SEVENTEEN was the first event in Winter 2007/2008 and the 29th straight event held on the back courts of Wall High School.
- *It had been three week dry spell without any new players.
- In the special holiday showdown, Tom Adams narrowly defeated John Tronolone, 5 to 4.
.. Tom Adams now 5-2-0, is one of the most dominant captains ever. In his most previous match, he defeated Alison Bertsch at NINETY-NINE one day shy of his 21st birthday.
.. John Tronolone suffered his record-breaking 8th loss, having gone winless the entire 2007 year. This was his record-tying 11th time as captain as well (along with Chris Adams).

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

DODGEBALL 118: Double Header Friday!
It was to see the return of the ever-so violent BoxBall Dodgeball. Plans however have been scrapped - what will happen on this special Friday event? Find out December 28.

DODGEBALL 119: Double Header Saturday!
The test of stamina and endurance continues on December 29. Who knows what to expect!

DODGEBALL CXX: Season Finale Extravaganza!
Their never-say-die drive and overall athletic ability have catapulted each of these deserving participants to the pinnacle of a dodgeball player's career. As announced at DODGEBALL ONE-SEVENTEEN, PLAYER of the Year nominee Ryan Letsche clashes with ROOKIE of the Year candidate Grant Cornero at the Season 12 Finale on January 5. This is will be a classic.
